channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: The next wave of Trump tariffs are expected to go into effect on Friday
item.description: NPR speaks with Ernie Tedeschi, director of economics at the Budget Lab at Yale, about trade deals and tariffs ahead of a Friday deadline imposed by President Trump.

item.title: U.S. and Chinese officials to meet in Sweden for trade talks
item.description: Chinese and American officials meet in Sweden for the latest in a series of ongoing trade talks. The talks come after President Trump announced a new trade deal with the European Union.

item.title: President Trump says he struck a trade deal with the EU during Scotland visit
item.description: President Trump is in Scotland. On Sunday, he said he struck a trade deal with the European Union. On Monday, he is expected to meet the prime minister of the U.K.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Israel to allow limited aid into Gaza as global outrage grows, President Trump announces trade deal with EU during Scotland trip, Pete Buttigieg discusses future of Democratic Party.

item.title: A look at the shifting roles within government under President Trump
item.description: NPR looks at how President Trump's actions have created a tension in Washington over who is responsible for the various aspects of the government.

item.title: Jack McAuliffe, who started the craft beer revolution in the U.S., has died at age 80
item.description: In the mid-'70s, Jack McAuliffe co-founded the first microbrewery in the U.S. since Prohibition. He died earlier this month at the age of 80.

item.title: Humanitarian worker confined to northern Gaza describes starvation there
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin talks with Amjad Al Shawa, veteran humanitarian worker confined to northern Gaza, about what starvation looks like there and how his own family is struggling.

item.title: Learn how to find sea glass on your next trip to the beach
item.description: NPR goes on a coast-to-coast hunt for treasure hiding in plain sight. Learn about sea glass and how to find it.

item.title: Alexandria Mayor Alyia Gaskins discusses Trump's executive order on homlessness
item.description: NPR's A Martinez speaks with Mayor Alyia Gaskins of Alexandria, Va., about President Trump's executive order that makes it easier for cities to remove homeless people from the streets.

item.title: At Repair Fairs, volunteers help people learn to fix their broken things
item.description: A growing movement of events — called Repair Fairs — want to help people learn to fix their broken things and, in turn, keep them out of landfills. NPR visits an event in northern New York.
